thread.title: NBN to deliver video services, such as Netflix, to all Australians, CEO says
thread.title_full: NBN to deliver video services, such as Netflix, to all Australians, CEO says | afr.com

author: David Ramli
title: NBN to deliver video services, such as Netflix, to all Australians, CEO says
text:
NBN chief executive Bill Morrow says his network will deliver 'Over-The-Top' services that people desire. Daniel Munoz He is also expected to say that the NBN will let all Australians access the growing market of OTT players who get content like TV shows and movies to customers over the internet instead of traditional TV systems.
Mr Morrow will use NBN traffic to show that the network is seeing a large spike in data downloads caused by OTT services.
Some experts believe the rise of ubiquitous high-speed broadband will accelerate the demise of broadcast television because it gives viewers the option of watching their content how and when they want it instead of relying on traditional scheduled programming.
But organisations like Free TV Australia strongly disagree and believe that linear TV will remain successful for years to come.
